RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: Possui graduao em Licenciatura Qumica pela Fundao Universidade Regional de Blumenau (1974), mestrado em Qumica pela Universidade Federal de Santa Catarina (1980) e doutorado em Qumica Inorgnica - Ruhr Universitt Bochum (1983). Realizou estgio Ps-Doc na Ruhr Universitt Bochum em 1987-1988 no Grupo de Pesquisas do Prof. Karl Wieghardt. Desde 1997 professor titular do Departamento de Qumica da Universidade Federal de Santa Catarina. Desde maio de 2008 membro titular da Academia Brasileira de Cincias . Em maio de 2010 foi admitido na Classe de Comendador da Ordem nacional do Mrito Cientfico.Tem experincia nas reas de Qumica Orgnica e Inorgncia, com nfase em sntese de Modelos Bioinspirados e suas aplicaes em catalise de substratos modelos do DNA. Consequentemente as pesquisas esto relacionadas com o efeito citotxico em clulas tumorais das novas drogas geradas.
RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN: graduate degree at Licenciatura Em Qumica from Fundao Universidade Regional de Blumenau (1974), master's at Chemistry from Universidade Federal de Santa Catarina (1980) and doctorate at Qumica Inorgnica from Ruhr Universitt Bochum (1983). Has experience in Chemistry, focusing on Inorganic Chemistry, acting on the following subjects: sintese, crystal structure, eletroquimica, caracterizacao and magnetoquimica.

OUTRAS-INFORMACOES-RELEVANTES.OUTRAS-INFORMACOES-RELEVANTES: Projeto 1: Laboratrio Multiusurio de Espectrometria de Massa (LEM) Sigla: LEM O principal objetivo deste projeto, a criao de um Laboratrio Multiusurio de Espectrometria de Massas (LME) composto de um espectrmetro de massa tipo LC-ESI/MALDI-Q-TOF (a ser adquirido neste projeto), que venha a beneficiar um grande nmero de pesquisadores e grupos de pesquisa, em vista da inexistncia deste equipamento no Estado de Santa Catarina. Vrios Centros (Cincias Biolgicas, Cincias Fsicas, Qumica, Cincias da Sade, Cincias Agrrias e Tecnolgico) da UFSC, assim como outras Instituies do Estado, podero dar um salto qualitativo e quantitativo nas suas pesquisas, com repercusses na produtividade cientfica e tecnolgica e na formao de recursos humanos.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Metalohidrolases Sintticas Ancoradas em Intercaladores do DNA e Nanopartculas de Ouro e Fe3O4.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: O projeto aqui apresentado est diretamente conectado a linha de pesquisas que vem sendo desenvolvida no Laboratrio de Binorgnica e Cristalografia da UFSC nos ltimos 06 anos e que busca aliar os avanos da nanobiotecnologia, em especial os nanobiomateriais e materiais magnticos, com o estado da arte da qumica bioinorgnica para o desenvolvimento de novas drogas funcionalizadas e destinadas a aplicaes biomdicas e em catlise. Especificamente, no presente projeto, pretende-se utilizar novas hidrolases/catecolases sintticas e algumas outras j bem caracterizadas em outros trabalhos do grupo, ancoradas de forma covalente no cromforo pireno, o qual bem conhecido como sendo uma molcula que intercala em pares de bases do DNA. Alm disso, em continuidade ao trabalho j desenvolvido pretende-se utilizar os mesmos catalisadores ancorados em nanopartculas de ouro e xido de ferro.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Efeitos da Segunda-Esfera de Coordenao em Metalohidrolases e Metaloproteases Sintticas. Materiais Nanoestruturados para Aplicaes em Catlise e Bioqumica.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: No presente projeto, pretende-se utilizar novas hidrolases/catecolases sintticas e algumas outras j bem caracterizadas em outros trabalhos do grupo, ancoradas de forma covalente no polmero biomimtico Polietilenoimina (PEI) Fig. 1, o qual tem sido utilizado como o esqueleto suporte de enzimas artificiais, mimetizando por exemplo as cadeias polipeptdicas dos stios ativos (2. Esfera de Coordenao).1k No preparo de stios ativos de enzimas artificiais sobre macromolculas sintticas, vrias metodologias tem sido empregadas. Por ex., diversos centros catalticos foram montados em torno de um templato e ento ligados com um espaador macromolecular e aps remoo do templato, um stio ativo artificial foi produzido. Figura 1.1h Alm disso, pretende-se realizar modificaes qumicas na PEI com a introduo de novos grupos funcionais do tipo HN-CH2-CH2-SH que nos permitam ancorar o polmero em nanopartculas de ouro e ao mesmo tempo ao catalisador biomimtico (complexo dinuclear). Tais procedimentos tem por objetivos principais: a) aumentar a efetividade cataltica do sistema dinuclear o qual pode adotar posies de cooperatividade altamente produtivas devido a Efeitos da 2. Esfera de Coordenao; b) obter sistemas com solubilidade adequada em gua, o que dever ser auxiliado pela presena da PEI atravs de seus grupos amina protonados; c) Tornar os sistemas catalticos adequados para utilizao dos mesmos em meio aquoso nos estudos de interaes com o DNA, protenas e clulas tumorais.1g,1h Alguns resultados preliminares bem sucedidos envolvendo o tema foram publicados recentemente por esse autor: Inorg. Chem. 2013, 52, 3594-3596. Vale destacar que, efeitos da 2. esfera de coordenao em processos de catlise envolvendo metalohidrolases sintticas, raramente tem sido estudados,1i embora tal fenmeno tenha sido bem descrito para algumas enzimas reais tais como as fosfatases cidas prpuras.1a Dessa forma esse tema de pesquisas representa um novo desafio para os qumicos bioinorgnicos.

Chitosan functionalized with 2[-bis-(pyridylmethyl) aminomethyl]4-methyl-6-formyl-phenol: equilibrium and kinetics of copper (II) adsorption

Synthesis, crystal structure and properties of dinuclear iron(III) complexes containing terminally coordinated phenolate/H2O/OH- groups as models for purple acid phosphatases: efficient hydrolytic DNA cleavage

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Abstract The unsymmetric dinucleating ligand N-(2-hydroxybenzyl)-N,N0,N0-tris(2-pyridylmethyl)-1,3-diaminopropan-2-ol (L = H2btppnol) and the corresponding copper(II) complex [Cu2(Hbtppnol)(l-CH3COO)](ClO4)2 (1) have been recently reported in part in a short communication [Inorg. Chem. Commum. 8 (1999) 334]. In this study, we investigated the ability of complex 1 to promote the hydrolysis of P O phosphate diester bonds in bis(2,4-dinitrophenyl) phosphate (2,4-BDNPP) and the cleavage of genomic and plasmid DNA molecules. Reaction of 1 with excess of the diester 2,4-BDNPP, at pH 7.0, results in the formation of the monoester phosphate coordinated [Cu2(Hbtppnol)(l-((NO2)2-C6H3)PO4)]ClO4 (3) complex, which was also characterized by X-ray crystallography. In addition, the stable l-phosphate complex [Cu2(Hbtppnol)(l-(NO2-C6H4)PO4)] (ClO4) (2) obtained from the reaction of 4-nitrophenyl phosphate with complex 1 was also characterized by X-ray crystallography, indicating that 1 is unable to cleave monoester phosphate bonds. The kinetics for the promotion of bis(2,4-dinitrophenyl) phosphate (2,4-BDNPP) hydrolysis by complex 1 was investigated as a function of pH, catalyst concentration and substrate concentration. On the basis of kinetic and potentiometric studies, the deuterium isotope effect (kH/kD 1) and the X-ray structure of the monoester phosphate coordinated [Cu2(Hbtppnol)(l-((NO2)2-C6H3)PO4)]ClO4 (3) complex as the product of the reaction, we demonstrated that the aquo/hydroxo CuII 2 L OH2 OH complex is the active species and the reaction occurs through the formation of a ternary complex in which one CuII binds the substrate and the second copper center has a terminal bound hydroxide to attack the phosphorus atom, at physiological pH. A rate enhancement factor of 100 was calculated relative to that measured for the uncatalyzed reaction under identical conditions. Complex 1 effectively promotes the cleavage of double-stranded genomic DNA.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Molecular modeling utilizing purple acid phosphatase biomimetic models

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Abstract: Purple acid phosphatases (PAPs) constitute a new class of metalloenzymes that catalyze the hydrolysis of certain phosphate esters, including nucleoside di- and triphosphates and aryl phosphates, under acidic conditions. To provide some insight into these metalloenzymes we have performed quantum chemical and molecular mechanics calculations based on the mixed-valence [FeIIFeIII(BPBPMP)(OAc)2]+ model complex (1) (H2BPBPMP=2-bis[{(2-pyridylmethyl)-aminomethyl}-6-{(2-hydroxybenzyl)-(2-pyridylmethyl)}-aminomethyl]-4-methylphenol). The geometric and the vibrational parameters calculated by molecular mechanics show that the force fields established in this work reproduce the binuclear iron core with -phenoxo or -alkoxo and di- -acetate bridges presented in the PAPs model complexes. The atomic orbital analysis of the SOMO contributions indicated that the FeIII atom and the terminal phenolate are involved in the phenolate to FeIII charge transfer electronic transition in 1 as argued from electronic spectroscopic data in the PAPs.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Synthesis, X-ray crystal structure and properties of a novel tetranuclear unsymmetrical (m-SO4) copper(II) complex: Relevance to SO2 fixation

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract
The synthesis, by fixation of SO2, the unusual crystal structure, and the spectral and redox properties of the new -SO4 2- compound [Cu4(TPPNOL)2( - SO4)2](ClO4)2 (1) [HTPPNOL (N,N,N -tris-(2-pyridylmethyl)-1,3-diaminopropan-2- ol)] are reported. Crystallographic data for 1: space group P9, a= 8.089(2), b= 13.255(3), c= 13.503(3) , = 67.21(3), = 74.46(3), = 80.42(3) , U= 1282.8(5) 3, Z= 2. In 1, the copper(II) ions are bridged by the alkoxo oxygen atoms of the HTPPNOL ligand and by exogenous sulphate bridges. The structure of 1 consists of a centro-symmetric tetranuclear core or a Dimer of Dimers complex, in which a -O,O -sulphate oxygen atom is further coordinated to the copper center of another similar dinuclear unit, resulting in a tetranuclear arrangement. The SO2 fixation was monitored by changes in the electronic spectra which indicated the formation of the intermediate hydroxo complex [Cu2(TPPNOL)(OH)2]+, in basic medium, which, we propose, acts as the nucleophile in the SO2 fixation mechanism.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: New mononuclear CuII and ZnII complexes capable of stabilizing phenoxyl radicals as models for the active form of galactose oxidase

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Abstract Herein we describe the synthesis and crystal structure of mononuclear CuII and ZnII complexes containing the new pentadentate H2L ligand (H2L = N- (methyl)-N -(2-pyridylmethyl)-N-N -bis(3,5-di-tert-butyl-2-hydroxybenzyl)- 1,3-propanediamine.The [CuII(L)] and [ZnII(L)] complexes and their oneelectron oxidized [CuII] + ([1] +) and [ZnII] + ([2] +) compounds exhibit electrochemical and spectroscopic (UV-Vis and EPR) features with relevant insight to the oxidizing half-reaction of the metalloenzyme galactose oxidase (GAO). _____________________________________________________________

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: A New unsymmetrical dinucleating ligand and its first FeIIIZnII complex: structure and solid state properties of an unexpected tetranuclear Fe2IIIZn2II complex containing the [FeIII(m-OH)2FeIII] structural motif

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Abstract: The synthesis and characterization of a new unsymmetrical N4O3-donor ligand (H2L1 = 2-[(2-pyridylmethyl)(carboxyamidomethyl)aminomethyl]-6-[(2-hydroxybenzyl)( 2-pyridylmethyl) aminomethyl]- 4-methyl phenol) and its dinuclear [(L1) FeIII( - OAc)2ZnII]+ complex are presented. Importantly, reported for the first time here is the X-ray structure and magnetic and Mssbauer properties of an unprecedented tetranuclear [Fe2 IIIZn2 II] complex containing the {FeIII( -OH)2FeIII} structural motif which can be easily obtained through the reaction of stoichiometric amounts of H2L1 and the perchlorate salts of [Fe(OH2)6]3+ and [Zn(OH2)6]2+ under mild basic conditions.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Hydrolytic Protein Cleavage Mediated by Unusual Mononuclear Copper(II) Complexes: X-ray Structures and Solution Studies

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The crystal structures and redox and UV-vis/EPR spectroscopic properties of two new mononuclear copper(II) complexes, [Cu(HL1)Cl2] (1) and [Cu(L1)Cl] (2), prepared through the reaction between copper(II) chloride and the ligand 2-[(bis(pyridylmethyl)amino)methyl]-4-methyl-6-formylphenol (HL1) under distinct base conditions, are reported along with solution studies. Also, we demonstrate that these CuII complexes are able to cleave unactivated peptide bonds from bovine serum albumin (BSA) and the thermostable enzyme Taq DNA polymerase at micromolar concentration, under mild pH and temperature conditions. The cleavage activity seems to be specific with defined proteolytic fragments appearing after protein treatment. The location of the specific cleavage sites was tentatively assigned to solvent-accessible portions of the protein. These are two of the most active Cu(II) complexes described to date, since their cleavage activity is detected in minutes and evidence is here presented for a hydrolytic mechanism mediating protein cleavage by these complexes.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Synthesis, structure and properties of unsymmetricall-alkoxo-dicopper(II) complexes: biological relevance to phosphodiester and DNA cleavage and cytotoxic activity

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Abstract The unsymmetric dinucleating ligand N-(2-hydroxybenzyl)-N,N0,N0-tris(2-pyridylmethyl)-1,3-diaminopropan-2-ol (L = H2btppnol) and the corresponding copper(II) complex [Cu2(Hbtppnol)(l-CH3COO)](ClO4)2 (1) have been recently reported in part in a short communication [Inorg. DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Catalytic effect of a dinuclear [Fe2(OH)OH2)] complex in the hydrolysis of bis(2,4-dinitrophenyl) phosphate

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Abstract The kinetics of the hydrolysis of bis(2,4-dinitrophenyl) phosphate (BDNPP) has been studied in the presence of a dinuclear Fe(III) complex that acts as a catalyst in the hydrolytic reaction. One equivalent of the 2,4-dinitrophenolate ion (DNP) and one equivalent of 2,4-dinitrophenylphosphate (DNPP) were liberated for each equivalent of BDNPP, and the reaction showed firstorder kinetics in relation to both BDNPP and the metal ion complex. Potentiometric titrations of the dinuclear complex are consistent with two deprotonation constants of the metal coordinated water molecules, with pKa values of 4.88 and 6.33 and the reactions show a pH dependence which is consistent with a Fe2(OH)(OH2) form as the reactive species during the hydrolytic reaction. The kinetics of the reaction show an inverse solvent isotope effect of 0.44, which is consistent with a pre-equilibrium proton transfer before the hydrolysis reaction of the BDNPP.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Nucleic acid cleavage by a Cu (II) polyaza macrocyclic complex.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The search for efficient artificial nucleases is a consequence of the huge efforts towards DNA sequencing by genome projects 13 around the world. In the present study, we describe the activity of the Cu(II) BMXD complex (BMXD = 3,6,9,17,20,23-hexaazatri- 14 cyclo[23.3.1.111,15]triaconta-1(29),11(30),12,14,25,27-hexaene) as a DNA cleavage agent. The rate constant for the DNA backbone 15 cleavage reaction at room temperature (25 C) and pH 7.0 was estimated to be 1.1 10 6 s 1, which corresponds, approximately, to 16 a half-life (t1/2) of one week. We demonstrated that the DNA cleavage reaction promoted by the Cu2BMXD complex may occur via 17 an oxidative pathway through performing reactions in the presence of free-radical acceptors and comparing the activity under aer- 18 obic and anaerobic conditions. The Cu2BMXD complex reported here is established as a novel artificial nuclease.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Synthesis, characterization and structure of a new zinc(II) complex containing the hexadentate N,N',N,N'-bis[(2-hydroxy-3,5-di-tert-butylbenzyl) (2-pyridylmethyl)]-ethylenediamine ligand: generation of phenoxyl radical species

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Abstract - This work summarizes the results of our studies on the structural, spectral and redox properties of a mononuclear zinc(II) complex with the new H2L ligand (H2L = N,N',N,N'-bis[(2-hydroxy-3,5-di-tert-butylbenzyl) (2-pyridylmethyl)]-ethylene diamine. The crystal structure of the complex [ZnII(HL)].ClO4 1 was determined by X-ray crystallographic analysis. The structure of this complex consists of a discrete mononuclear cation [ZnII(HL)]+, in a strongly distorted geometry with a slight tendency toward a distorted square pyramidal geometry, as reflected by the structural index parameter t of 0.44. The zinc(II) cation is coordinated to one oxygen and four nitrogen atoms: the pyridine nitrogen atoms (N22 and N32), tertiary amine nitrogen atoms (N1 and N4) and phenolate oxygen atom (O10). 1H and 13C NMR spectral data show a rigid solution structure for 1 in agreement with X-ray structure. Potentiometric studies of complex 1 were also performed and revealed three titratable protons which are attributed to the protonation/deprotonation of two phenol groups (p[K]a1 = 4.04 and p[K]a3 = 11.34) and dissociation of a metal-bound water molecule (p[K]a2 = 7.8). The phenolate groups in complex 1 are suitably protected by bulky substituents (tert-butyl) in the ortho- and para- positions, which through electrochemical oxidation generate a one-electron oxidized phenoxyl species in solution. This radical species was characterized by UV-Vis, EPR and electrochemical studies. The Zn(II)-phenoxyl radical species is of bioinorganic relevance since its spectroscopic, redox and reactivity properties can be used to establish the role of phenoxyl radicals in biological and catalytical systems.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: A new heterobinuclear FeIIICuII complex with a single terminal FeIII O(phenolate) bond. Relevance to purple acid phosphatases and nucleases

DETALHAMENTO-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-PERIODICO-OU-REVISTA: JBIC. Journal of Biological and Inorganic Chemistry (Online)

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Abstract A novel heterobinuclear mixed valence complex [FeIIICuII(BPBPMP)(OAc)2]ClO4, 1, with the unsymmetrical N5O2 donor ligand 2-bis[{(2-pyridylmethyl) aminomethyl}-6-{(2-hydroxybenzyl)(2-pyridylmethyl)} aminomethyl]-4-methylphenol (H2BPBPMP) has been synthesized and characterized. A combination of data from mass spectrometry, potentiometric titrations, X-ray absorption and electron paramagnetic resonance spectroscopy, as well as kinetics measurements indicates that in ethanol/water solutions an [FeIII (l)OH CuIIOH2]+ species is generated which is the likely catalyst for 2,4-bis(dinitrophenyl)phosphate and DNA hydrolysis. Insofar as the data are consistent with the presence of an FeIII-bound hydroxide acting as a nucleophile during catalysis, 1 presents a suitable mimic for the hydrolytic enzyme purple acid phosphatase. Notably, 1 is significantly more reactive than its isostructural homologues with different metal composition (FeIIIMII, where MII is ZnII, MnII, NiII, or FeII). Of particular interest is the observation that cleavage of double-stranded plasmid DNA occurs even at very low concentrations of 1 (2.5 lM), under physiological conditions (optimum pH of 7.0), with a rate enhancement of 2.7 107 over the uncatalyzed reaction. Thus, 1 is one of the most effective model complexes to date, mimicking the function of nucleases.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: First-Transition-Metal Complexes Containing the Ligands 6-Amino-6-methylperhydro-1,4-diazepine (AAZ) and a New Functionalized Derivative: Can AAZ Act as a Mimetic Ligand for 1,4,7-Triazacyclononane?

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The structure and physicochemistry of the [NiII(AAZ)2](ClO4)2 (1) complex (AAZ ) 6-amino-6-methylperhydro-1,4-diazepine), as a system that is able to mimic some important chelate properties of 1,4,7-triazacyclononane, are reported. The syntheses of a new unsymmetric AAZ-functionalized ligand and the structure of its first heterodinuclear FeIIIZnII complex are also presented.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Kinetics and equilibrium adsorption of Cu(II), Cd(II), and Ni(II) ions by chitosan functionalized with 2[-bis-(pyridylmethyl)aminomethyl]-4-methyl-6-formylphenol

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Electronic Effects of Electron-Donating and -Withdrawing Groups in Model Complexes for Iron-Tyrosine-Containing Metalloenzymes

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Three new iron(III) complexes with the ligand N, N -bis(2-hydroxybenzyl)- N, N -bis(pyridin-2-ylmethyl)ethylenediamine, H2bbpen, containing electron-donating and -withdrawing groups (Me, Br, NO2) in the 5-position of the phenol rings were synthesized and fully characterized by IR spectroscopy, ESI mass spectrometry, and CHN elemental analyses. X-ray structures of the iron(III) complexes containing NO2 and Me groups were determined. The effects of the substituents on the electronic properties of the complexes were detected by UV-visible spectroscopy, cyclic voltammetry, and X-ray crystallography. Linear correlations between the Hammett parameter for the substituents (p) and the FeIII/FeII redox potentials or ligand-metal charge-transfer (LMCT) processes of the complexes were obtained. A theoretical study using DFT is presented and shows good agreement between the experimental and calculated data.

DETALHAMENTO-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-PERIODICO-OU-REVISTA: Journal of the Brazilian Chemical Society

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: We describe herein the synthesis, crystal structure and 1H NMR properties of the mononuclear [ZnII(L-Br)].2H2O complex containing the hexadentate H2L-Br ligand (H2L-Br = N,N -bis-(5- bromo-2-hydroxybenzyl)-N,N -bis-(pyridin-2-ylmethyl)-ethane-1,2-diamine). DFT calculations demonstrate very good agreement between parameters calculated and those determined by X-ray crystallography, and reveal that only the phenolate groups of the H2L-Br ligand participate in the formation of the HOMO, while only one of the pyridine rings contributes to the LUMO formation.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: A mixed-valence diacetate-bridged Mn-II-Mn-III complex incorporating a bridging phenolate ligand

DETALHAMENTO-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-PERIODICO-OU-REVISTA: Acta Crystallographica. Section C, Crystal Structure Communications

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Abstract: The synthesis and characterization of a new unsymmetrical dinucleating N,O-donor ligand, 2-[N,N-bis(2-pyridylmethyl)aminomethyl]-6-[N-(3,5-di-tert-butyl-2-oxidobenzyl)-N-(2-pyridylamino)aminomethyl]-4-methylphenol (H(2)Ldtb), as well as the X-ray crystal structure of its corresponding mixed-valence diacetate-bridged manganese complex, di-mu-acetato-mu-{2-[ N,N- bis(2-pyridylmethyl)aminomethyl]-6-[ N-(3,5-di-tert-butyl-2-oxidobenzyl)-N-(2-pyridylamino)aminomethyl]-4-methyl-phenolato}dimanganese(II,III) tetraphenylborate, [Mn-II-Mn-III(C42H49N5O2)(C2H3O2)(2)](C24H20B), are reported. The complex may be regarded as an interesting structural model for the mixed-valence Mn-II-Mn-III state of manganese catalase.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Reported herein are the synthesis and characterization of the hexadentate H2L pro-ligand (N,N ,N,N -bis[(2-hydroxy-3,5-di-tert-butylbenzyl)(2-pyridylmethyl)]ethylenediamine), as a further derivative of the well known pro-ligand H2bbpen which contains two phenolate and two pyridyl pendant arms. The phenolate groups in H2L are suitably protected by bulky substituents (tert-butyl) in the ortho- and para- positions, from which stable phenoxyl radical complexes can be formed. Thus, we have synthesized four new mononuclear complexes with MnIII, GaIII, InIII and FeIII which through electrochemical oxidation generate one- and two-electron oxidized phenoxyl species in solution. These radical species were characterized by UV-Vis, Electronic Paramagnetic Resonance and electrochemical studies. As expected, in the case of the GaIII, InIII and FeIII complexes no metal-centered oxidation was observed. However, the manganese complex undergoes metal- and ligand-centered oxidation processes and therefore a phenoxyl radical- MnIV complex can be generated in solution. The crystal structures of the [MnIII(L)]+ and [GaIII(L)]+ complexes were determined by X-ray crystallographic analyses revealing monocationic complexes with distorted octahedral geometries.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Complex [Fe2III(BPClNOL)2(SO4)] 3 was synthesized through the reaction of the proligand N-(2-hydroxybenzyl)-N-(2-pyridylmethyl)[(3-chloro)(2-hydroxy)]propylamine (H2BPClNOL) and FeSO4.7H2O. The maximum absorption for the oxidized compound was at 519 nm ( = 1.40 ~103 dm3 mol-1 cm-1) while that of the mixed-valence compound was at 439 nm ( = 9.8 ~102 dm3 mol-1 cm-1). The redox process to transform the oxidized compound to the mixed-valence form occurs at E1/2 = -0.843 V vs. Fc/Fc+. The Mossbauer spectrum confirms the presence of FeIII high spin ions and the magnetic studies reveal a weak antiferromagnetically coupled dimer, J/kB = - 15 K ( J = -10.4 cm-1). Complex 3 is the third of a family of dinuclear iron compounds synthesized with the H2BPClNOL ligand ([Fe2III(BPClNOL)2(OAc)]+ 1,[Fe2III(BPClNOL)2(H2O)2]2+ 2). Analysis of the physicochemical properties of these complexes allowed us to infer that the number and kind of bridging groups have a significant influence on their electrochemical and UV-Vis properties.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The reaction of Fe(ClO4)3.nH2O with N,N f-bis[(2-hydroxybenzyl)-N,N f-bis(1-methylimidazole- 2-yl-methyl)]ethylenediamine (H2bbimen) affords two geometric isomers, A and B, of the complex cation [Fe(bbimen)]+, which were fully characterized by IR and UV-visible spectroscopies, ESI mass spectrometry, molar conductivity measurements, cyclic voltammetry, spectroelectrochemistry and EPR spectroscopy. The geometry of one of these isomers has been clearly demonstrated through X-ray crystallographic analysis. It crystallizes in the monoclinic system, space group P21/c, a = 14.104 (3), b = 15.626 (3), c = 13.291 (3) A, = 98.07 (3)o, Z = 4, R1 = 6.35% and wR2 = 20.57%. The electrochemical properties of [Fe(bbimen)]+ (-0.58 V versus NHE) are quite similar to those of transferrins (-0.52 V versus NHE) and indicate that it is a good model for the redox potential of these metalloenzymes. EPR spectroscopy was the only spectroscopic technique able to differentiate the isolated isomers A and B. EPR studies revealed that isomer A is better described as a rhombically distorted (E/D . 0.33) highspin FeIII complex (g1 . 4.1 with a shoulder at g2 . 9.0), while the spectrum of B has a set of lines at g1 . 3.0, g2 . 3.6 and g3 . 5.1, in addition to the line at g1 . 4.2 and a shoulder at g2 . 9.0, which have been ascribed to FeIII complexes in axial symmetry (E/D . 0.22). Semi-empirical theoretical studies, combined with EPR data, were essential to the proposition of the geometric structures of A and B.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Raman excitation profiles for the complex [FeIIFeIII(bpbpmp)(C2H3O2)2](ClO4) (1), and its oxidized form, the new compound [FeIIIFeIII(bpbpmp)(C2H3O2)2](ClO4)2 (2), are reported. H2bpbpmp is the proligand 2-bis[{(2-pyridylmethyl)-aminomethyl}-6-{(2-hydroxybenzyl)(2- pyridylmethyl)}-aminomethyl]-4-methylphenol. For compound 1, the most enhanced vibrational mode in the Raman spectra is the (Fe-Ophen_terminal), observed at 608 cm-1. For compound 2, the (COphen_terminal), which corresponds to the band at 1276 cm-1, becomes the most enhanced one. These differences are ascribed to the changes in the electronic structure of the dinuclear phenolate bridged core upon oxidation. The phenolate bridge allows charge density transmission between the metal centers.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: In this paper, synthesis, characterization and antimycobacterial properties of a new water-soluble complex identified as silver-mandelate are described. Elemental and thermal analyses are consistent with the formula [Ag(C6H5C(OH)COO)]n. The polymeric structure was determined by single X-ray diffraction. The NMR 13C spectrum in D2O shows that coordination of the ligand to Ag(I) occurs through the carboxylate group in solution. Potentiometric titration shows that only species with a molar metal:ligand ratio of 2:2 are formed in aqueous solution. The mandelate complex and the silver-glycolate, silver-malate and silver-hydrogen- tartarate complexes were tested against three types of mycobacteria, Mycobacterium avium, Mycobacterium tuberculosis and Mycobacterium kansasii, and their minimal inhibitory concentration (MIC) values were determined. The results show that the four complexes are potential candidates for antiseptic or disinfectant drugs for discharged secretions of patients affected with tuberculosis.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: An Unprecedented FeIII(u-OH)ZnII Complex that Mimics the Structural and Functional Properties of Purple Acid Phosphatases

DETALHAMENTO-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-PERIODICO-OU-REVISTA: Journal of the American Chemical Society

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Abstract This communication reports the synthesis and X-ray structure of the first mixed-valence FeIIIZnII complex containing the FeIII(-OH)ZnII structural unit. Based on the structure, physicochemical solution studies and the catalytic properties towards the hydrolysis of the diester 2,4-bis(dinitrophenyl)phosphate (BDNPP) it is proposed that complex 1 employs a hydrolytic mechanism similar to that proposed for red kidney bean purple acid phosphatase, including a nucleophilic attack by the terminal, FeIII-bound hydroxide and the concomitant release of 2,4-dinitrophenolate. Furthermore, it is demonstrated that the -hydroxo group in the {FeIII(-OH)(-ROPO3)ZnII} intermediate is unable to hydrolyze the monoester 2,4-dinitrophenylphosphate (DNPP), which suggests that the -hydroxo group is a significantly poorer nucleophile than the terminally FeIII-bound OH- group.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Catalytic promiscuity has emerged as an important property of many enzymes since it has become clear that it has implications in evolutionary relationships as for example, the question of how proteins in nature evolve new functions such as antibiotic resistance or the ability to degrade man-made chemicals. Simultaneously, the design and development of suitable biomimetic catalytic systems capable of mimicking the catalytic promiscuous properties of such enzymes represents a new challenge for bioinorganic chemists. In this work we will report on the synthesis, characterization and detailed solution and kinetic studies of a series of dinuclear FeIIICuII and CuIICuII (Figure 1) complexes which are able to cleave diester bonds in model substrates and DNA itself. Furthermore, we will also discuss in some details the cathecolase-like activity (catalytic promiscuity) of these biomimetics in the oxidation of 3,5-di-tert-butylcatechol.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Catalytic promiscuity has emerged as an important property of many enzymes since it has become clear that it has implications in evolutionary relationships as for example, the question of how proteins in nature evolve new functions such as antibiotic resistance or the ability to degrade man-made chemicals. Simultaneously, the design and development of suitable biomimetic catalytic systems capable of mimicking the catalytic promiscuous properties of such enzymes represents a new challenge for bioinorganic chemists. In this work we will report on the synthesis, characterization and detailed solution and kinetic studies of a series of dinuclear FeIIICuII and CuIICuII (Figure 1) complexes which are able to cleave diester bonds in model substrates and DNA itself. Furthermore, we will also discuss in some details the cathecolase-like activity (catalytic promiscuity) of these biomimetics in the oxidation of 3,5-di-tert-butylcatechol.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Bioinspired Metal Complexes as Artificial hydrolases and catecholases
A. Neves LABINC Laboratory of Bioinorganic and Crystallography, Department of Chemistry UFSC, 88040-900, Florianpolis SC, Brazil ademir@qmc.ufsc.br
Although most enzymes have evolved to be very effective catalysts for specific reactions, many also catalyze other reactions due to the presence of highly reactive groups in the active site. Indeed, promiscuous enzymes provide a repertoire of capabilities that can be drawn upon when conditions change and a new catalytic activity is important for fitness.1 In the present work, the synthesis, physicochemical characterization and the catalytic activity of a wide range of new bioinspired model metal complexes which are able to cleave phosphodiesters models, DNA and to oxidize catechol substrates will be discussed.2
References: 1) P. J. O Brien; D. Herschalag, Chem. Biol. 1999, 6, R91. 2) Mitic, N.; Smith, S. J.; Neves, A.; Guddat, L. W.; Gahan, L. R.; Schenk, G. Chem. Rev. 2006, 106, 3338.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Resumo A sntese de sistemas estruturais e funcionais biomimticos para uma variedade de metaloenzimas, certamente constitui um dos mais atrativos temas atuais de investigao no contexto da qumica bioinorgnica.1 Por exemplo, o mecanismo proposto para a hidrlise de monosteres e disteres de fosfato (promiscuidade cataltica) atravs das enzimas fosfatases cidas prpuras (PAPs), oriundas de mamferos e plantas, tem suporte nas propriedades espectroscpicas e cinticas de complexos modelos sintticos.2 No presente trabalho, ns apresentaremos a importncia de alguns procedimentos sintticos na qumica orgnica e inorgnica, adotados no preparo de ligantes e complexos dinucleares de valncia mista, como modelos estruturais e funcionais para as metalloenzimas hydrolases e catecis oxidases. Alm disso, tambm reportaremos a sntese e atividade cataltica de sistemas conjugados hidrolase-intercalador do DNA denominados de Compostos de 2. Gerao, como possveis drogas sintticas anti-cancer, conforme mostrado na Fig. 1.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract Second Coordination-sphere Effects Increase the Catalytic Efficiency of Hydrolases Biomimetics
Ademir Neves LABINC Laboratory of Bioinorganic and Crystallography, Department of Chemistry UFSC, 88040-900, Florianpolis SC, Brazil Ademir.neves@ufsc.br
Phosphatases, oxidases and a variety of other enzymes have been successfully modeled through metal complexes that can reproduce their physico-chemical properties and even their catalytic activity, however with a much lower efficiency.1 As has been suggested, these discrepancies in catalytic efficiency between model compounds and true enzymes are, by a large extent, due to the lack of many important intramolecular interactions in the second-coordination sphere of the model systems in comparison to the enzyme.2 In this work we propose a new extension of dinuclear hydrolases models by binding the FeIIIMII catalytic unit to a small polyethyleneimine chain (PEI, 1200 Da) that can emulate the enzyme microenvironment around the active site (Figure 1).2 In addition we also present the synthesis, characterization and hydrolase activity of conjugates in which the well known DNA intercalator pyrene is anchored to the FeIIIMII catalytic center.2

Second Coordination-sphere Effects Increase the Catalytic Efficiency of Hydrolases Biomimetics
Ademir Neves,a Bernardo de souza,a Tiago P. Camargo,a Hernn Terenzi,b Tiago Bortolotto,b
LABINC Laboratrio de Bioinorgnica e Cristalografia, Departamento de Qumica, CEBIME Centro de Biologia Molecular Estrutural, Departamento de Bioqumica, UFSC, 88040-900, Florianpolis SC, Brazil. Ademir.neves@ufsc.br
Phosphatases, oxidases and a variety of other enzymes have been successfully modeled through metal complexes that can reproduce their physico-chemical properties and even their catalytic activity, however with a much lower efficiency.1,2 As has been suggested, these discrepancies in catalytic efficiency between model compounds and true enzymes are, by a large extent, due to the lack of many important intramolecular interactions in the second-coordination sphere of the model systems in comparison to the enzyme.2 In this work we propose a new extension of dinuclear hydrolases models by binding the FeIIIMII ((MII = Zn, Cu) catalytic unit to a small polyethyleneimine chain (PEI, 1200 Da) that can emulate the enzyme microenvironment around the active site (Fig. 1).2 In addition we also present the synthesis, characterization and hydrolase activity of conjugates in which the well known DNA intercalator pyrene is anchored to the FeIIIMII catalytic center.3

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
ABSTRACT
Nature has learned to make use of special properties of metals to achieve a wide variety of functions associated to living beings. Metalloproteins that perform catalytic functions are denominated metalloenzymes, characterizing then a special class of bioinorganic compounds. In this context, the purple acid phosphatases (PAPs), metalloenzymes belonging to the hydrolase class, catalyse the activated phosphorous esthers and anidrides' hydrolysis in a pH range between 4 and 7. The characteristic purple color of this acid phophatase subclass is a consequence of a ligand metal charge transference process (OTyr?FeIII) of around 560 nm. The complex models had a fundamental role on the understanding of the physical-chemical properties of the PAPs, before of its X-ray crystal structures' resolution. In this way, through the structural and spectroscopic studies as well as reactivity tests, the search of the most likely mechanism through the catalytic process occurence is done. This data will help substantially clarify the real mechanism that occurs in the native enzyme. In this work was synthesized and characterized by CHN elemental analysis; conductivity measurements; infrared, electronic and Mssbauer spectroscopy; electrochemistry and potentiometric titration, two new complexes of iron(III)cobalt(II) and gallium(III)cobalt(II) with the unsymmetrical ligand H2BPBPMP already described at the literature. The complexes 1 - [FeIIICoII(BPBPMP)(?-OAc)2]ClO4 . 0,25 H2O and 2 - [GaIIICoII(BPBPMP)(?-OAc)2]ClO4 . H2O had their crystal structures resolved and so, presented isostructural among themselves, being pointed as potencial structural models for metallo-substituted PAPs as they mimetize the aminoacids residues present in the active site of the PAPs and simulate their intermetallic distance. The catalytic activity studies performed towards 2,4-BDNPP substrate, resulted in acceleration factors of 19.2 and 21.2 thousand times respectively, if compared to non-catal

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Muitas reaes importantes para a manuteno da vida na Terra so catalisadas por metaloenzimas (enzimas com pelo menos um on metlico em seu stio ativo). Dentre as metaloenzimas pode-se citar as catecol oxidases, que catalisam a oxidao de o-catecis s correspondentes o-quinonas e as hidrolases/nucleases sintticas, que catalisam a clivagem de steres de fosfato. Diversos complexos metlicos que visam modelar estrutural e/ou funcionalmente essas metaloenzimas tm sido estudados nas ltimas dcadas, com o objetivo de elucidar o seu modo de ao. Neste trabalho foram sintetizados e caracterizados por anlise elementar de CHN, espectroscopia eletrnica, eletroqumica, titulao potenciomtrica e espectrofotomtrica, EPR e magnetoqumica dois novos complexos binucleares de cobre(II) empregando-se os dois novos ligantes contendo tomos N,O-doadores: H2L1 - N ,N ,N tris-(2-piridilmetil)- N-(2-hidrxi 3,5-di-terc-butilbenzil) - 1,3-propanodiamina 2-ol e H3L2 - N ,N bis-(2-piridilmetil)- N,N- (2-hidrxibenzil)(2-hidrxi-3,5-di-terc-butilbenzil) -1,3-propanodiamina 2-ol. Os complexos 1 - [Cu2(HL1)(-OAc)](ClO4)2 e 2 - [Cu2(HL2)(-OAc)](ClO4) tiveram suas estruturas cristalinas resolvidas por difratometria de raios-X. Alm disso, 1 e 2 foram testados frente a oxidao do substrato 3,5-di-terc-butil-catecol, revelando que esses podem ser considerados como modelos funcionais para as catecol oxidases e frente a hidrlise do substrato bis(2,4-dinitrofenil)fosfato, apresentando alta eficincia cataltica, com aceleraes de 855 e 1315 vezes para 1 e 2, respectivamente, quando comparados s reaes no catalisadas. A partir dos dados estruturais, espectroscpicos, eletroqumicos e cinticos, foi possvel propor um ciclo cataltico tanto para a oxidao do 3,5-di-terc-butil-catecol, quanto para a hidrlise do bis(2,4-dinitrofenil)fosfato, mediada pelos complexos 1 e 2, podendo os mesmos serem considerados complexos promscuos, modelos funcionais tanto

DADOS-BASICOS-DE-ORIENTACOES-CONCLUIDAS-.TITULO: Desenvolvimento de Novos Modelos Estruturais e Funcionais para as Fosfatases cidas Prpuras

DETALHAMENTO-DE-ORIENTACOES-CONCLUIDAS-P.NOME-DA-AGENCIA: Cons Nac Des

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: As Fosfatases cidas Prpuras constituem uma classe de metaloenzimas hidrolticas que contm um stio ativo dinuclear do tipo FeIIIMII (MII = Fe, Mn ou Zn), capaz de promover a hidrlise de uma variedade de steres de fosfato e anidridos numa faixa de pH de 4-7. Essas enzimas tem sido isoladas de plantas, animais e fungos, e sua intensa colorao deve-se ao processo de transferncia de carga tirosinato FeIII. Recentemente, as estruturas cristalinas da kbPAP, ratTRA, rbPAP e ufPAP foram determinadas, indicando grandes similaridades entre elas e um mecanismo comum para a hidrlise de steres de fosfato. Na estrutura determinada para a kbPAP (2,65 ) o on FeIII encontra-se coordenado por um resduo de tirosina, uma histidina e um aspartato, enquanto o zinco coordenado por duas histidinas e uma asparagina. Os dois stios metlicos so ponteados por um carboxilato monodentado de um resduo aspartato, e por uma ponte m-OH modelada. Os ligantes gua e hidrxido terminais, tambm modelados, completam a esfera de coordenao dos ons FeIII e ZnII, respectivamente. importante enfatizar que o ambiente quimicamente distinto em torno dos centros de FeIII e ZnII essencial para as propriedades catalticas da enzima. Assim, de acordo com o mecanismo proposto, durante a catlise o grupo fosfato liga-se ao zinco onde ativado/orientado por esse centro para um ataque nucleoflico do hidrxido terminal ligado ao stio de FeIII sobre o tomo de fsforo. O grupo de sada ento protonado, seguido da quebra da ligao P-OR, onde os produtos da reao so liberados e a enzima reestabelecida a forma cataliticamente ativa. A partir dessas informaes, parece claro que a utilizao de ligantes binucleantes N,O-doadores que possam induzir ambientes de coordenao assimtricos para os centros metlicos e stios vagos ou lbeis para reatividade uma estratgia conveniente na busca de modelos estruturais e funcionais para as PAPs. DADOS-BASICOS-DE-ORIENTACOES-CONCLUIDAS-.TITULO: Estudo de compostos Capazes de Clivar o DNA

PALAVRAS-CHAVE.PALAVRA-CHAVE-3: Complexos binucleares de cobre e ferro

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: O desenvolvimento de reagentes que promovem eficiente clivagem no DNA constitui um desafio na atualidade e tem recebido ateno em muitos laboratrios devido sua aplicao potencial para o desenvolvimento de novas nucleases, para a utilizao como agentes teraputicos e ferramentas teis em toda a biologia molecular. Neste trabalho, ns demonstramos nove compostos que foram capazes de clivar o DNA atravs de um possvel mecanismo hidroltico, sob condies brandas de pH e temperatura. Os compostos [Fe2III(BPClNOL)2(H2O)2](ClO4)2 (1), [Fe2III(BPClNOL)2 (SO4)]. H2O (2), [Cu2(H2bbppnol)OAc(H2O)2]Cl2 . 2H2O (3), [ Cu2(Hbtppnol) (OAc)] (ClO4)2 (4), [Cu(HISMIMI)Cl2] (5), [ Cu(HISMIMA)Cl2] (6), 1,3-bis (p-carboxifenil)triazeno (7), 1-(p-carboxifenil)-3-(p-amidofenil)triazeno (8) e 3-(p-carboxifenil)- 1-feniltriazeno 1 xido (9), foram analisados por eletroforese em gel de agarose 0,8 % , correndo a 50 V por 2 h. O DNA foi visualizado atravs da colorao com brometo de etdio. As bandas coradas foram quantificadas usando um scanner ptico (ColorPage-VividPro) e um programa de clculo da Scion Image (scion Corp.). As posies na eletroforese das formas superenovelda (F I), circular aberta (F II) e linear (F III) foram confirmadas por digesto do DNA com uma enzima de restrio. A fim de verificar se a clivagem ocorria por hidrlise da ligao fosfodister do DNA ou por uma reao mediada por radical livre que pudesse decompor o acar do DNA, reaes com dimetilsulfxido, glicerol e tiouria como seqestradores do radical hidroxil foram realizadas. Tambm, para os complexos de metais foi adicionado sulfato de crio (CeIV) para manter o estado de oxidao do metal, e evitar a interferncia de reaes redox na clivagem. Reaes anaerbicas (atmosfera de argnio) foram realizadas a fim de verificar a dependncia do oxignio molecular na degradao do DNA pelos compostos. INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract
Oxidation of organic substrates by molecular oxygen under mild conditions is a reaction of great interest for many synthetic and industrial processes, from a both economic and environmental point of view. Although the reaction of organic substances with dioxygen is thermodynamically favored, it is kinetically hindered owed to the fundamental triplet state of O2. In the live systems, a series of notable biological catalysts known by the name of enzymes promotes oxidative reactions with high rates and specificity. Among them, we can make mention to the group of catechol oxidases (COs), copper-containing metalloenzymes that possess a binuclear Cu2 core in their active site and catalyze the oxidation of o-diphenols (catechols) to the corresponding o-quinones. In last years, lots of effort have been dispended with the objective of mimic the several enzymatic functions, which can be made by means of the synthesis of smaller and less-complicated model compounds able to play similar catalytic roles. In this work, we have prepared four new dinucleating ligands: 4-methyl-2,6-bis[(6-methyl-1,4-diazepan-6-yl)iminomethyl]phenol (HL1), 2-[N,N-bis(2-pyridylmethyl)aminome-thyl]-4-methyl-6-[(6-methyl-1,4-diazepan-6-yl)iminomethyl]phenol (HL2), 2-[N,N-bis(2-pyri-dylmethyl)aminomethyl]-6-[(2-hydroxyphenyl)iminomethyl]-4-methylphenol (H2L3) and 2-[N,N-bis(2-pyridylmethyl)aminomethyl]-6-[(2-hydroxyphenyl)aminomethyl]-4-methylphenol (H2L4). Using the synthesized ligands, a series of three novel Schiff base dinuclear copper(II) complexes, namely, [Cu2(-OH)(L1)](ClO4)2 H2O (1), [Cu2(-OH)(L2)(ClO4)]ClO4 (2) and [Cu2(-OH)(L3)]ClO4 (3), all of them containing a single -hydroxo bridge, was obtained and fully characterized by elemental analysis, IR and UV-vis spectroscopies, EPR, magnetic and conductance measurements and electrochemistry. INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: A Equipe constituda pelos Professores Drs. Ademir Neves, Marcos A. de Brito, Valdir Rosa Correia, Valfredo T. de Fvere e Alfredo Tibrcio Nunes Pires, num esforo conjunto da CAPES, FINCITEC, SEED e UFSC, promoveram nos anos de 1997 e 1998 os Cursos de Especializao I, II e III para Professores do Ensino Mdio em Santa catarina, envolvendo as Disciplinas de Qumica Geral, Qumica Inorganica, Qumica Analtica, Qumica Orgnica e Fsico- Qumica atendendo diversos plos no Estado: Florianpolis, Itaja, Lages, Canonhas
